lines.content: Horizon is a chatbot that can help store your tasks, if you don't mind her attitude.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
2. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
2. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
3. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
3. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.
4. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Main.java` file, right-click it, and run it. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
Hello. You may call me Horizon.
Looks like you need me to remember things for you. Again.
1. 'todo [task description]': Adds a todo with a description.
2. 'deadline [task description] /by [date YYYY-MM-DD]': Adds a deadline with a description and date.
3. 'event [task description] /from [date YYYY-MM-DD] /to [date YYYY-MM-DD]': Adds a event with a description and dates.
5. 'mark [num]': Mark the selected task as done.
6. 'unmark [num]': Mark the selected task as not done.
9. 'bye': Exits the chatbot, saving the data to a file.
* Initiates the chatbot, causing it to print a greeting and
* read existing tasks from a text file.
* Exits the chatbot and saves the tasks to a text file.
* @throws IOException If the text file is invalid.
* Runs the chatbot. Reads and executes user commands.
* Represents an exception for the chatbot.
* @param description The error message of the exception.
* Main class. Creates, runs, and exits the chatbot.
* Parses input into commands, creates, and returns a Command object.
* @param input User input to be parsed.
* @throws ChatbotException If the command entered is invalid.
public static Command readCommand(TaskList taskList, String input) throws ChatbotException {
throw new ChatbotException("I don't know what that is. Type 'help' for help. ");
* A class used to read and write data from and to a text file.
* Creates a new file if one does nor yet exist.
public static void createFile() throws IOException {
* @return The list of tasks read from the file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If file is not found.
* @throws ChatbotException If file has formatting errors.
public TaskList readFile() throws FileNotFoundException, ChatbotException {
throw new ChatbotException("Text file formatting error. Fix it and try again. ");
* Writes the current tasks to a file.
* @param taskList The list of tasks to write.
* @throws IOException If file path does not exist.
public static void writeFile(TaskList taskList) throws IOException {
* Represents a command to exit the chatbot.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
* Represents a command to add a Deadline object.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Executes the command to add a Deadline object.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
public void execute(boolean isReading) throws ChatbotException {
* Represents a command to delete a task.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Executes the command to delete a task.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
* @throws ChatbotException If index out of bounds.
public void execute(boolean isReading) throws ChatbotException {
throw new ChatbotException("You only have " + taskList.getListLength() +
* Represents a command to add a Event object.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Executes the command to add a Event object.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
public void execute(boolean isReading) throws ChatbotException {
* Represents a command to find a task/s.
* @param keyWords The keywords to look for.
public FindCommand(TaskList taskList, String keyWords) throws ChatbotException {

* Executes the command to find a task/s.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
* Represents a command to display available commands.
* Executes the command to display available commands.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
* Represents a command to list all tasks.
* Executes the command to list all tasks.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
* Represents a command to mark a task.
* @param description The description of the task, which is converted to an index.
* Executes the command to mark a task.

* @throws ChatbotException If index out of bounds.
public void execute(boolean isReading) throws ChatbotException {
throw new ChatbotException("You only have " + taskList.getListLength() +
* Represents a command to add a Todo object.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Executes the command to add a Todo object.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
* Represents a command to unmark a task.
* @param description The description of the task, which is converted to an index.
* Executes the command to unmark a task.
* @param isReading If the chatbot is reading a file, during which it will not display confirmation text.
*@throws ChatbotException If index out of bounds.
public void execute(boolean isReading) throws ChatbotException {
throw new ChatbotException("You only have " + taskList.getListLength() +
* Represents a Deadline Task with a single date.
throw new ChatbotException("Formatting error. Use /by to state timing. ");
throw new ChatbotException("Date format error. Use YYYY-MM-DD. ");
* Represents a Event task with a start and end date.
throw new ChatbotException("Formatting error. Use /from and /to to state timings. ");
throw new ChatbotException("Date format error. Use YYYY-MM-DD. ");
* Represents a list of tasks of the chatbot.
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param isMarked If the task had been marked as done or not.
* @param task The task to be added.
public void addTask(boolean isMarked, Task task) {
* @param taskNum The index of the task to delete.
* Marks the last item in the list.
* Finds and prints tasks containing a keyword.
* @param keyWords The keyword/s to look for.
* Represents the user interface for the chatbot.
* Contains the messages to be printed.
System.out.println("Hello. You may call me Horizon. \n" +
"Looks like you need me to remember things for you. Again. ");
System.out.println("You already have tasks. Type 'list' to take a look? ");
System.out.println("Bye. If I save your stuff, will you leave for good? ");
System.out.println("Want to know what I can do? \n" +
"Use 'find' to look for a specific task. \n" +
"Also, type 'bye' to exit. I suggest this one. ");
System.out.println("Got it. Don't worry, I won't forget. ");
System.out.println("Not as incompetent as I thought. Marked. ");
System.out.println("Failing to meet expectations, are we? Unmarked. ");
